segments.key_quote: Maharaj Pariksit, thus being petitioned by the personality of Kali, gave him permission to reside in places where gambling, drinking, prostitution and animal slaughter were performed.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.17.38) about Maharaj Pariksit allowing Kali to reside in places of gambling, drinking, prostitution, and animal slaughter.
segments.transcript: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam Devi Saraswati Vyasam Tato Jayam Udhirayam. In this session, we will be discussing from the 38th verse of the 17th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. This is a fresh session which is continuing from the previous session. Previous session we discussed part 1 of this 38th verse, now we will discuss part 2 and in the next session we will discuss part 3 because there is a very big purport here written by Srila Prabhupada. So I will just read this verse once again, 38th verse of the 17th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, Suta Vacha Abhyarthitas Tadatasmai Sthanani Kalaye Dadau Deutam Panam Striya Suna Yatra Adharma Chatur Vidhah. The meaning of this verse is, Suta Goswami said, Maharaj Pariksit, thus being petitioned by the personality of Kali, gave him permission to reside in places where gambling, drinking, prostitution and animal slaughter were performed. So Maharaj Pariksit gave Kali Purusha four places, Deutam Panam Striya Suna, Deutam means gambling, Panam means drinking, Pras and Striya means prostitution and Suna means animal slaughter.

segments.key_quote: Drinking against the principles of scriptures, association with women outside marriage, killing animals against the injunction of scriptures are all adharma or all irreligious.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the basic principles of irreligiosity and how they counteract the principles of religion, referencing Srila Prabhupada's purport and Srila Jiva Goswami's commentary, focusing on drinking, illicit relations, and animal slaughter.
segments.transcript: So we discussed in the previous session that the basic principles of irreligiosity, they counteract the four principles of religion. And we discussed how counteraction happens in the previous session. Now, Srila Prabhupada says in the purport further, the personality of Kali was given permission to live in four places particularly mentioned by the king. Namely, the place of gambling, the place of prostitution, the place of drinking, and the place of animal slaughter. Four specific places were given for Kali Purusha by Maharaj Pariksit. So, now something about what is Dharma and what is Adharma as regards these four activities are specifically explained by Srila Prabhupada, with reference to Srila Jeeva Goswami's commentary on this verse in his writings. Srila Jeeva Goswami is one of the six Goswamis, the direct disciples of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. So, Srila Prabhupada says in the next part of the purport, Srila Jeeva Goswami directs the drunken people and the unmarried woman with the five principles of the scriptures that drinking against the principles of scriptures, such as the Sautramaaniyagna, association with woman outside of marriage, killing animals against the injunctions of scriptures, are irreligious. Irreligious means Adharma. Three things are specifically mentioned. Drinking against the principles of scriptures, association with women outside marriage, killing animals against the injunction of scriptures are all adharma or all irreligious.

segments.key_quote: The Vedic injunction for the pravartas the ordinary people those engaged in material enjoyment is to gradually regulate their activities towards the path of liberation
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the different scriptural injunctions for 'pravrittas' (those engaged in material enjoyment) and 'nivrttas' (those liberated from material bondage), emphasizing that the aim of the Vedas is to free everyone from material bondage and help them progress back to Godhead.
segments.transcript: Now we have to carefully understand what does it mean that these acts are irreligious only if they are against the scriptures and what do scriptures allow in terms of drinking, illicit connection with women and or rather association with women and killing animals. What do scriptures allow? scriptures say so Prabhupada first of all clarifies in the Vedas two different types of injunctions are there for the pravrittas and for the nivrittas so dharma or scriptural injunctions are there differently explained for two different categories of persons who are the pravrittas pravrittas are those who are engaged in material enjoyment and nivrittas are those who are liberated for from material bondage so pravrittas who are regular ordinary people they are somehow in ignorance and they are engaged in material enjoyment so what is the scriptural injunctions of practicing Dharma for the normal people ordinary people the pravartas those engaged in material enjoyment and what are those scriptural injunctions specifically meant for nivrittas or those liberated from material bondage there are different injunctions so Srila Prabhupada further says the Vedic injunction for the pravartas the ordinary people those engaged in material enjoyment is to gradually regulate their activities towards the path of liberation so the injunctions in this scriptural injunctions are the same as the pravartas scriptures are meant to regulate the activities of the ordinary common people so that these common people progress towards liberation not that they follow the scriptures and they remain in bondage no the aim of the Vedas whether it is for the pravartas or nivrittas is ultimately to free them from material bondage and to help them progress after becoming liberated to go back to Godhead we should not forget this merely attaining liberation from material bondage is not enough there is a further progress to be made after liberation to go back to Godhead where we all belong

segments.key_quote: For those who are in the lowest stage of ignorance and who indulge in wine women and flesh there are scriptural rules how to regulate their activities
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on how scriptures provide regulations for those in the lowest stage of ignorance (tamasic people) who indulge in wine, women, and flesh, such as drinking after Sautramani Yagna, associating with women only through marriage, and eating animal flesh after sacrifice.
segments.transcript: therefore Srila Prabhupada further says for those who are in the lowest stage of ignorance and who indulge in wine women and flesh there are scriptural rules how to regulate their activities in this connection how to regulate their drinking how to regulate their association with women how to regulate them in the matter of eating flesh so for drinking liquor for the pravrittas there is a injunction that they may drink liquor after performing Sautramani Yagna the pravrittas may associate with women only through marriage and the pravrittas may eat animal flesh and drink liquor after performing Sautramani Yagna after offering a goat in sacrifice so we should always remember that these recommendations in the Vedas for the pravrittas is meant for pravrittas only and not for everyone you it's not meant for everyone so these pravrittas for whom such allowance is given are those in the lowest stage of ignorance they are tamasic people they are situated in tamoguna so it is not meant for those who are not in tamoguna it's not meant for those in rajoguna or sattvaguna no so when the people who are thumbsick they indulge in drinking liquor or eating flesh animal flesh or they indulge in associating with women they may do so according to the injunctions of the scriptures by following the sacrifice meant for offering a goat to Kali or by offering some liquor to again Kali in Sautramani yajna or they may associate with women after getting married to them according to the Vedic injunctions so for such thumbsick people under Vedic regulation which is meant for thumbsick people pravrittas there is no consideration of sin I'm sorry there's no consideration of being punished by being sent to hell if they kill a goat and offer it in sacrifice to Kali or they offer wine in a Sautramani yajna and then partake of the remnants of such offering or they indulge in sex with a woman after being duly married to that woman

segments.key_quote: One man's food may be poisoned for others similarly what is recommended for those in the mode of ignorance may be poisoned for those in the mode of goodness
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing that scriptural allowances for certain classes of people (tamasic) should not be considered universally applicable, and such activities are adharma for sattvic and rajasic people, stressing the importance of careful discrimination and understanding the context of scriptural injunctions.
segments.transcript: so do not pray to Lord Shiva for anything else but only to improve one's health in hell so these injunctions in the scriptures are only for thumbsick people it is not meant for every one so Shruthi Prabhupada says one man's food may be poisoned for others similarly what is recommended for those in the mode of ignorance may be poisoned for those in the mode of goodness Srila Jiva Goswami Prabhupada says that recommendations in the scriptures for certain class of men are never to be considered adharma or irreligious for them but in general for people who are not in the tamasic stage all such activities are never to be encouraged and they are factually adharma for sattvic people and rajasic people the recommendations like soutramani yajna etc are actually not to be followed for them all sorts of recommendations like that are not to be followed for them all sorts of meat-eating and all sorts of drinking liquor are prohibited so therefore one has to be very careful that simply because the shastras allow for a certain class of people some animal sacrifice or offering of wine in some yagna and then partaking the remnants doesn't mean everyone can do it no so this clarification Srila Prabhupada is giving in the purport to this particular verse the 38th verse which says that Kali Purusha was given four places and one has to be careful and the later verses and purports will clarify this more I
